content: When you say, ‘the West’, don’t you mean the United States and to a lesser extent the United Kingdom? Most other countries in the West have ‘public healthcare, education, transport, finance’. The United States is saddled with the myth of ‘freedom’ and the belief that since some individuals have managed to rise above the adversity of humble beginnings, all people have this ability. The ones who don’t succeed, therefore just haven’t worked hard enough. Couple that with an education system that emphasises producing diplomas rather than thinkers, then come election day, you will end up with derisively unsuitable candidates like Clinton and Trump. Until those fundamental myths are demolished, U.S. society is likely to be further unequal and polarized.
